The Mo Ghara scheme provides financial assistance to lower and middle-class rural citizens of Odisha to build or repair their pucca houses, offering up to ₹3 lakh with a 10-year repayment period and government subsidy. Some schemes launched by the Government of Odisha: Biju Yuva Sashaktikaran Yojana (2013-14), Kalinga Siksha Sathi (2016), Banishree Yojana (2008), Madhu Babu Pension Yojana (2008), Kishori Shakti Yojana (2007).

question: When was ‘Nai Chetna-Pahal Badlav Ki’ campaign launched? SSC MTS 17/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: November 2022. The ‘Nai Chetna-Pahal Badlav Ki’ campaign was launched on 25th November 2022 with the theme of ‘Elimination of Gender-Based Violence’. It was a month-long initiative conducted as a 'Jan Andolan' (people's movement) across all States and Union Territories of India. The campaign aimed to raise awareness about gender-based violence and promote changes in societal attitudes.

question: In May 2023, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Ministry has extended the deadline of its Smart Cities Mission to ________. SSC MTS 18/10/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: June 2024. The mission was launched in 2015, and the deadline for completing the projects was originally set for 2019-2023. The mission has been extended until March 2025. As of July 2024, 100 cities have finished 90% of the total projects (7,188 projects). The Government of India has identified 100 cities for development under the Smart Cities Mission.

question: What is the name of the scheme launched by the Government of India in 2023 to effectively resolve pending contractual disputes? SSC MTS 18/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Vivad se Vishwas II. It was announced in the Union Budget 2023-24 by the Union Finance Minister. The scheme provides graded settlement terms depending on the status of disputes, offering up to 85% settlement of the awarded amount for court cases and up to 65% for arbitral awards under specified conditions​.

question: Identify the group of states that is a part of Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan (As of June 2022). SSC MTS 18/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Uttar Pradesh and Jharkhand. The Garib Kalyan Rojgar Abhiyaan was launched on June 20, 2020, to boost employment and livelihood opportunities for migrant workers returning to villages in the wake of the COVID-19 outbreak.

question: Who inaugurated 'Vibrant Village Program' in april 2023? SSC MTS 21/10/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Amit Shah. The Vibrant Villages Programme (VVP) is a centrally sponsored scheme launched in February 2023 to foster the development of villages along India's northern border. It covers 46 blocks in 19 districts across the states of Arunachal Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Sikkim, Uttarakhand, and the Union Territory of Ladakh. The program focuses on improving the quality of life in these areas and includes: Tourism and Cultural Promotion, Infrastructure Development, Livelihood Generation, etc.

question: According to National Multidimensional Poverty Index 2023 (A Progress Review), what was the proportion of population in multidimensional poverty (Headcount Ratio) in rural India in 2019-2021 ? SSC MTS 28/10/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 19.28%. The National Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) assesses deprivations in health, education, and living standards, using 12 key indicators like child mortality, education, sanitation, and housing​. Despite improvements over 2015-2021, with 135 million people moving out of poverty, rural areas still face significant challenges​. This highlights the need for continued focus on reducing rural poverty through comprehensive development programs.

question: What is the rank of India in the Global Hunger Index (GHI) 2023? SSC MTS 28/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 111. The Global Hunger Index (GHI) is a measure used to assess hunger levels worldwide, based on four indicators: undernourishment, child wasting, child stunting, and child mortality. It provides a score from 0 (no hunger) to 100 (extremely alarming), with countries ranked accordingly. The index is published annually by Concern Worldwide and Welthungerhilfe and helps track global hunger progress. Countries with higher scores face significant challenges related to poverty, healthcare, and food security. The GHI is an important tool for shaping policies and guiding international aid efforts.

question: Which of the following Union Territories of India marks the lowest poverty in National Multidimensional Poverty Index: A Progress Review 2023? SSC MTS 29/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Puducherry. The National Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI), launched by NITI Aayog, evaluates poverty beyond income, focusing on deprivations in health, education, and living standards. It uses indicators like nutrition, child mortality, school attendance, and access to clean water. The 2023 review showed a significant reduction in multidimensional poverty, with 135 million people moving out of poverty between 2015-2021. However, rural areas still face notable challenges. This index helps tailor policies for inclusive development across states and Union Territories​.

question: In 2023, the Government of India proposed 'Amrit Dharohar Scheme' to be implemented over the next _____________ to encourage optimal use of wetlands and enhance bio-diversity, carbon stock, eco-tourism opportunities and income generation for local communities. SSC MTS 29/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Three Years. The Amrit Dharohar Scheme focuses on promoting the sustainable use of wetlands, a crucial ecological resource. It aims to enhance biodiversity, increase carbon stock, and boost eco-tourism potential. Additionally, it seeks to provide income-generating opportunities for local communities dependent on wetlands. By balancing conservation and livelihood, the scheme aspires to ensure long-term ecological and economic benefits. This initiative aligns with India's commitment to environmental sustainability and community welfare.

question: On 10 April 2023, the Government of India launched tourism infrastructure and amenities in the ____ villages through the ‘Vibrant Villages Programme’. SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Border. Government has approved Vibrant Villages Programme (VVP) as a Centrally Sponsored Scheme on 15th February, 2023 for comprehensive development of the select villages in 46 blocks in 19 districts of abutting northern border in the States of Arunachal Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Sikkim, Uttarakhand and UT of Ladakh.

question: According to National Multidimensional Poverty Index 2023 (A Progress Review), what is the percentage of the total population who are multidimensionally poor (Headcount Ratio) in Bihar state? SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 33.76%. The National Multidimensional Poverty Index (NMPI) is a measure of poverty that considers multiple dimensions beyond monetary aspects. It is calculated by multiplying the headcount ratio (H) and the intensity of poverty (A). The NMPI is based on the global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) model, but with two additional indicators: Maternal Health and Bank Account.

question: On 25 August 2023, which State Government expanded its ongoing 'Breakfast Scheme' for students of classes 1 to 5, studying in 31,008 government schools across the State? SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Tamil Nadu. The Chief Minister's breakfast scheme was launched On September 15, 2022. On August 25, the scheme was extended to the entire state. The scheme will be extended to cover 15.75 lakh students of class one to five in 31,008 government schools across the state. The initiative will benefit students studying in schools from 1st to 5th standard across the entire state.

question: Mukhya Mantri Sikho Kamao Yojana was launched by which of these state governments? SSC MTS 4/11/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Madhya Pradesh. The Mukhyamantri Seekho Kamao Yojana was launched by the state government of Madhya Pradesh on June 15, 2023. The scheme aims to help young people in the state acquire the skills they need to get jobs by providing them with training in various fields.

question: The ___________ scheme, that covers artisans related to 18 fields, was included under the 'Payments Infrastructure Development Fund' ('PIDF') scheme by the Reserve Bank of India in October 2023. SSC MTS 4/11/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: PM Vishwakarma. PM Vishwakarma is a scheme aimed at supporting artisans and craftspeople working with tools in 18 trades. It offers benefits such as recognition through certificates and ID cards, skill upgradation training, and toolkit incentives of up to Rs. 15,000. The scheme also provides collateral-free loans of up to Rs. 3 lakh, digital transaction incentives, and marketing

question: As per National Multidimensional Poverty Index report 2023, what is the poverty rate of India (2019-21)? SSC MTS 5/11/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 14.96%. The National Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) report is a publication by NITI Aayog that provides estimates of multidimensional poverty in India. The 2023 edition of the report is based on data from the 5th round of the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5) conducted in 2019-21.

question: According to the National Multidimensional Poverty Index of India: A Progress Review 2023, which of the following states has the LOWEST percentage of population being multidimensionally poor? SSC MTS 5/11/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Sikkim. According to the National Multidimensional Poverty Index - A Progress Review 2023, Kerala has the lowest percentage of the population that is multidimensionally poor, at 0.71%. Here are the multidimensional poverty percentages for some other states: Goa - 3.76%, Sikkim - 3.82%, Tamil Nadu - 4.89%, West Bengal - 11.89%, Gujarat - 11.66%.

question: Which of the following locations has NOT been selected for setting up the seven PM Mega Integrated Textile Region and Apparel (PM MITRA) Park for the textile sector announced by the Government of India in March 2023? SSC MTS 5/11/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: West Bengal. The Government of India announced 7 PM MITRA Parks in Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Gujarat, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, and Maharashtra to boost the textile industry. Inspired by the 5F vision (Farm to Fibre to Factory to Fashion to Foreign), these parks aim to enhance competitiveness, attract FDI, and create jobs. Selected from 18 proposals, they will provide world-class infrastructure, plug-and-play facilities, and training centers. The Centre will provide financial support of up to Rs. 500 crore per park and up to Rs. 300 crore for unit incentives. State governments will offer 1000+ acres of land and essential utilities. With Rs. 70,000 crore investment and 20 lakh jobs expected, the initiative aims to make India a global textile hub.

question: According to the Human Development Index 2023-24, what is the rank of India? SSC MTS 11/11/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: 134. The Human Development Index (HDI) is a composite measure of life expectancy, education, and per capita income, ranking countries into four tiers of human development. Key indicators include life expectancy at birth, mean and expected years of schooling, and GNI per capita. India ranks 134 out of 191 countries on the HDI. In 2020, it ranked 131st among 189 nations. The decline, reflecting global trends due to the COVID-19 pandemic, is linked to a drop in life expectancy at birth, which fell from 70.7 to 67.2 years in 2021.

question: Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY) is a scheme launched in 2015 for providing loans up to ________ lakh to the non- corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises. SSC MTS 12/11/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 10. The Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY), launched by the Prime Minister on April 8, 2015, has been instrumental in empowering non-corporate, non-farm small and micro enterprises by offering loans of up to ₹10 lakh. The scheme features three categories: Shishu, for loans up to ₹50,000; Kishore, for loans between ₹50,001 and ₹5,00,000; and Tarun, for loans ranging from ₹5,00,001 to ₹10,00,000.

question: In 2023, Government of India has announced to set up a/an ______________ DigiLocker for use by MSMEs, large businesses and charitable trusts to store and share documents online securely. SSC MTS 12/11/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Entity. DigiLocker, a flagship initiative of the Ministry of Electronics & IT under the Digital India programme, provides citizens with secure cloud-based storage, sharing, and verification of digital documents. MSMEs (Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises) are small businesses, including startups, crucial to India's GDP, employment, and socio-economic development.

question: As of July 2023, how many products were notified under the 'One District, One Product' scheme as per the information provided by the Ministry of Food Processing Industries, Government of India? SSC MTS 13/11/2024 (1st Shift)

Maharashtra's 36 districts have 20 unique ODOPs, while West Bengal has not recommended any. A digital GIS map shows ODOP details for 713 districts, including 216 Integrated Tribal Development Areas, 112 Aspirational districts, and 35 SC districts with 40% SC population, aiding beneficiaries in resource identification.

question: As in July 2021,The NIPUN Bharat Scheme was launched by which of the following Ministries? SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: Under the ‘Mero Rukh Mero Santati’ initiative launched by the Sikkim Chief Minister Prem Singh Tamang in 2023, how many trees will be planted for every child born in Sikkim ? SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: Consider the following statements and identify the INCORRECT statement(s). 1. The ‘Saksham Anganwadi and Poshan 2.0’ scheme has been implemented under the National Food Security Act, 2003. 2. It is an ongoing, Central Government- sponsored scheme under the Ministry of Women and Child Development. 3. It is extended to children aged below 6 years only. 4. Six services are provided under this scheme through the National Health Mission and Public Health Infrastructure. SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Only 1, 3 and 4. Saksham Anganwadi and Poshan 2.0 is an Integrated Nutrition Support Programme. It seeks to address the challenges of malnutrition in children, adolescent girls, pregnant women and lactating mothers. The scheme has been approved by the Government of India for implementation during the 15th Finance Commission period 202l-22 to 2025-26. Key Components: (i) Supplementary Nutrition Programme for children (6 months to 6 years), pregnant women, lactating mothers, and adolescent girls (14 to 18 years) in Aspirational Districts and the North Eastern Region (NER). (ii) Early Childhood Care and Education (3-6 years) and early stimulation for (0-3 years).

The portal focuses on enhancing their skills to handle the pandemic more effectively.

question: What is the cost of the ‘Nand Baba Milk Mission’ scheme launched by the Uttar Pradesh state government in 2023 to provide milk producers the facility of selling their milk at a reasonable price in villages through dairy co-operative societies? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: ₹1,000 crore. The main objective of the scheme is to provide employment to the youth and women of rural areas in the state by engaging them in livestock farming, increasing the number of advanced breed cows in the state, and improving the breed of indigenous cows. The scheme was launched on June 6, 2023.

question: Which of the following is a key focus area of the 'Amrit Dharohar' scheme launched by the Prime Minister Narendra Modi on World Environment Day, 2023? SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: C. To promote values of local
solution.explanation: The Amrit Dharohar Yojana aims to conserve existing Ramsar sites in India through active public participation. Ramsar sites are wetlands of international significance designated under the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands. India’s first Ramsar sites, Chilika Lake in Odisha and Keoladeo National Park in Rajasthan, were designated in 1981. The Ramsar Convention, signed on February 2, 1971, in Ramsar, Iran, established this international framework. The world’s first Ramsar site, the Cobourg Peninsula in Australia, was designated on May 8, 1974.

question: In year 2023, the Government of India launched which of the following schemes to bring Indian-origin researchers to higher educational institutions in the country? SSC CHSL 01/07/2024 (2nd shift)

question: On 7th March 2022, the Government initiated a scheme to re-enrol out-of-school adolescent girls (OoS AG) in the age group of 11-14 years. What is the name of the scheme? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

question: According to the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare 2022-23, which state of India is the largest producer of sugarcane? SSC MTS 08/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Uttar Pradesh accounts for 38.6% of India's total sugarcane production. Maharashtra and Karnataka are the second and third largest producers of sugarcane in India, respectively. Together, these three states produce around 80% of India's sugarcane. India is the world's largest producer and consumer of sugar, and the world's second largest exporter of sugar.

question: According to Economic Survey 2023-24, which of the following states is the largest wheat producing state of India? SSC MTS 09/10/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. Agriculture contributes 17.5% to India's GDP. Uttar Pradesh is the top producer of wheat and sugarcane, followed by Punjab, Haryana, and Madhya Pradesh for wheat, and Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu for sugarcane. Gujarat leads in cotton production, followed by Maharashtra, Telangana, and Karnataka. Agriculture is the main occupation in Uttar Pradesh, where wheat is the main food crop and sugarcane the main commercial crop. West Bengal is the top paddy producer, while Uttar Pradesh leads in wheat.

question: Which country was a major importer of dye intermediates and castor oils from India in 2022-23? SSC MTS 30/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

question: Which of the following sectors engaged the largest percentage of women workers in the year 2019-2020? SSC MTS 13/11/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: In the year 2021, the Department of Public Enterprises has now been made part of the ________Ministry, to speed up the privatisation process and exercise greater financial control over the state-run-enterprises. SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: Finance. Total 6 departments come under the ministry finance - Department of Economic Affairs, Department of Expenditure, Department of Financial Services, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management, Department of Public Enterprises, Department of Revenue.

question: The country's infrastructure vision for FY-2025 and the first exercise to be conducted in India is named as ________. SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (4th shift)

solution.explanation: National Infrastructure Pipeline. It is a group of social and economic infrastructure projects in India over a period of five years with an initial sanctioned amount of ₹100 lakh crore. The pipeline was first made public by the Prime Minister of India Narendra Modi during his 2019 Independence Day speech. Aims: To improve project preparation and attract investments into infrastructure.

question: As per the Economic Survey 2022-23, the Labour Force Participation Rate for males has gone up to ________in 2020-21. SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: 57.5%. The Labour Force Participation Rate for males has gone up to 57.5% in 2020-21, as compared to 55.6% in 2018-19. The Female Labour Force Participation Rate rose to 25.1% in 2020-21 from 18.6% in 2018-19, with a notable increase in Rural Female Labour Force Participation Rate from 19.7% to 27.7% during the same period.

question: As per the decision by the Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) of the Government of India in 2023, the MSP for Paddy (Common) has been fixed at _________ higher than the last season. SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd shift)

solution.explanation: 7%. MSP, or Minimum Support Price, is a program in India that ensures farmers receive a minimum price for their crops. It is based on recommendations from the Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP), which was established in January 1965 and operates under the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare. The CACP recommends MSPs for 22 mandated crops, including 14 kharif crops, 6 rabi crops, and 2 commercial crops, as well as a fair and remunerative price (FRP) for sugarcane.

question: On the 46th Civil Accounts Day, as a part of 'Ease of Doing Business (EoDB) and Digital India eco-system', the Government of India introduced which of the following? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: E-bill processing system. Nirmala Sitharaman launched the Electronic Bill (e-Bill) processing system, during the 46th Civil Accounts Day in 2022. Objectives : Provide convenience to all vendors/suppliers of the government to submit their bills/claims at anytime, from anywhere. Eliminate physical interface between suppliers and government officers. Enhance efficiency in processing of bills/claims. Reduce discretion in processing of bills through the “First-In-First-Out” (FIFO) method.

question: According to the global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) 2021, India’s rank is ________ out of 109 countries. Graduate Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: 66. The Oxford Poverty and Human Development Initiative (OPHI) publishes the Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI), which aims to assess acute multidimensional poverty in emerging countries using various indicators. Created in 2010, the MPI is a joint effort between OPHI and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

question: In 2023, Government of India has proposed to set up ‘Central Processing Centre’ for faster response to organisations through centralised handling of various forms filed with field offices under the _____________. Graduate Level 25/06/2024 (Shift - 3)

solution.explanation: Companies Act. In 2023, the Government of India proposed the establishment of a Central Processing Centre (CPC) under the Companies Act. The Ministry of Corporate Affairs (MCA) announced its setup in a notification on February 2, 2024. Located at IMT Manesar, the CPC will process electronic forms (e-forms) related to various company matters, including incorporation, closure, and regulatory compliance. Once fully operational, it is expected to handle around 2.50 lakh forms annually. Polity

question: As of October 2023, the 31 𝑠𝑡 senior-most member (in terms of age) in the Lok Sabha, Shafiqur Rahman 17 𝑡ℎ Barq represents which political party? SSC MTS 30/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Samajwadi Party. The Samajwadi Party (SP) was founded by Mulayam Singh Yadav on October 4, 1992. The party is based in Uttar Pradesh. Other prominent leaders of Samajwadi Party : Dimple Yadav, Iqra Choudhary, Harendra Singh Malik, Awadhesh Prasad etc.

question: When was the National Judicial Commission Bill, which is a private member bill to regulate the appointment of judges through the National Judicial Commission, introduced in Rajya Sabha? SSC MTS 01/10/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: December 2022. The National Judicial Commission Bill was introduced in the Rajya Sabha on December 9, 2022, by CPI(M)'s Bikash Ranjan Bhattacharya. The bill aims to regulate the appointment of judges to the Supreme Court and High Courts by establishing a National Judicial Commission. In 2015, the Supreme Court declared the National Judicial Appointments Commission Act, 2014, unconstitutional, reinstating the collegium system for judicial appointments.

question: Who among the following is the ex-officio Chairperson of the Rajya Sabha as on 10 October 2023? SSC MTS 07/10/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Jagdeep Dhankar. The Vice President of India is the ex-officio Chairman of Rajya Sabha as per Article 64. Virendra Kumar - Union Minister of Social Justice and Empowerment .Piyush Goyal - Union Minister of Industry and Supply of India. Prakash Javadekar- A former Union Minister.

question: In its 279th report released in April 2023, the Law Commission of India has recommended the provision of which law to be retained? SSC MTS 07/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Sedition Law. The Law Commission of India recommended retaining the provision for Sedition under Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code, 1860. Section 124A describes sedition as ‘attempts to excite disaffection against the Government established by law’. The provision has been widely criticised for being a tool for curbing dissent.

question: In December 2022, the Parliament passed the Energy Conservation (Amendment) Bill, 2022 This bill aims to make use of _____. SSC MTS 09/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: non-fossil fuels. The Energy Conservation (Amendment) Act, 2022 is an amendment to the Energy Conservation Act, 2001. The Act requires designated consumers to meet a minimum share of their energy consumption from non-fossil sources. This includes industries like mining, steel, cement, and textiles, as well as commercial buildings and the transport sector.

question: The strength of the Supreme Court has increased to how many judges as of 13 Feb 2023? SSC MTS 14/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 34. The original Constitution of 1950 envisaged a Supreme Court (Article 124) consisting of a Chief Justice and 7 puisne judges. The number of judges increased over time: 8 in 1950, 11 in 1956, 14 in 1960, 18 in 1978, 26 in 1986, 31 in 2009, and 34 in 2019 (the current strength). Established - On 28 January 1950. The first Chief Justice of India - Harilal J. Kania.

question: The Integrated Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Bill, 2023 was introduced in Lok Sabha on 11 August 2023, which amends the ________. SSC MTS 16/10/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.correct_answer: A. Integrated Goods and Services Tax
solution.explanation: Integrated Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Bill, 2023, introduces several key changes to the IGST Act, primarily aimed at addressing the growing sector of online money gaming and refining tax provisions related to cross-border transactions and goods supply. Integrated Goods and Services Tax a type of indirect tax that is levied on the interstate supply of goods and services in India.

question: Women's Reservation Bill 2023 [The Constitution (One Hundred Twenty-Eighth Amendment) Bill, 2023] was introduced in Lok Sabha on ________. SSC MTS 29/10/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 19 Sep 2023. The Women's Reservation Bill 2023, officially titled The Constitution (One Hundred Twenty-Eighth Amendment) Bill, 2023, was introduced in the Lok Sabha on September 19, 2023 by Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal. This historic bill seeks to reserve one-third of seats for women in the Lok Sabha, state legislative assemblies, and the Delhi legislative assembly, promoting gender equity in political representation.

question: The Uttarakhand Public Services (Horizontal Reservation for Women) Bill, 2022 provides how much reservation to women? SSC MTS 4/11/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 30 %. A legislative bill providing reservation to women in state government jobs has been approved by Uttarakhand Governor, Lt Gen (Retd.) Gurmit Singh in January 2023. According to the Uttarakhand Public Services (Horizontal Reservation for Women) Bill 2022, women candidates who permanently reside in Uttarakhand will be given preference for 30% of open positions in public services and posts after July 24, 2006, with 20% of the vacancies being filled through horizontal reservation.

question: The Anusandhan National Research Foundation Bill, 2023 was introduced in Lok Sabha on 4 August 2023, which repeals the __________. SSC MTS 5/11/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: The Anusandhan National Research Foundation Bill, 2023 was introduced in Lok Sabha on August 4, 2023. It repeals the Science and Engineering Research Board Act, 2008 and dissolves the Science and Engineering Research Board set up under it. The Bill provides for establishing the Anusandhan National Research Foundation (NRF). Functions of NRF: NRF will be the apex body in the country to provide strategic direction for research, innovation, and entrepreneurship in the fields of: (i) natural sciences including mathematics, (ii) engineering and technology, (iii) environmental and earth sciences, (iv) health and agriculture, and (v) scientific and technological interfaces of humanities and social sciences.

question: As of July 2023, who was the Member of Parliament from the parliamentary constituency of Varanasi? SSC MTS 5/11/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Narendra Modi. The Varanasi Lok Sabha constituency, one of 80 in Uttar Pradesh, has been a stronghold of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), winning 8 terms since its inception in 1952. Narendra Modi, born on September 17, 1950, has been elected thrice from Varanasi and has served as Prime Minister of India since 2014. Prior to this, he was the Chief Minister of Gujarat from 2001 to 2014.

question: As on 31st October 2023, the youngest member of parliament (in terms of age) in the 17th Lok Sabha, Chandrani Murmu, represents which political party? SSC MTS 11/11/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Biju Janata Dal. The Biju Janata Dal (BJD), a regional political party in Odisha, was founded by Naveen Patnaik on December 26, 1997, as a breakaway from the Janata Dal. Led by Patnaik as president, its headquarters is in Forest Park, Bhubaneswar. Chandrani Murmu (born June 16, 1993) is an Indian politician elected to the Lok Sabha from Keonjhar, Odisha.

question: Which of the following amendments, made in September 2023, is known as 'Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam'? SSC MTS 14/11/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: 128th. The Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam reserves one-third of seats in the Lok Sabha, state assemblies, and Delhi assembly for women, including SC/ST women. Effective after the next census and delimitation, the reservation lasts 15 years, extendable by Parliament, with seats rotating after each delimitation.

question: The government of which of the following states created a draft policy in 2022 for senior citizens on the basis of article 41, which aims to form a directorate for the welfare of senior citizens? SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: Tamil Nadu. Schemes related to senior citizens: National Policy on Older Persons (1999), Rashtriya Vayoshri Yojana (2017), Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme (2007).

question: When was the High Court and Supreme Court Judges (Salaries and Conditions of Service) Amendment Bill, 2021 introduced in Lok Sabha? SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 30 November 2021. This Bill was introduced by the Minister of Law and Justice, Kiren Rijiju. The bill amended the High Court Judges (Salaries and Conditions of Service) Act, 1954, and the Supreme Court Judges (Salaries and Conditions of Service) Act, 1958. The bill's main purpose was to clarify when retired judges would receive enhanced pension. The bill was passed by the Lok Sabha on December 8, 2021, and by the Rajya Sabha on December 13, 2021.

question: The Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Act, 2019 deals with subsistence allowance in which of the following Sections? SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (3rd Shift)

solution.explanation: Section 5. Important Sections: Section 4-Punishment for pronouncing talaq . Section 6- Custody of minor children. Section 7- Offences to be cognizable, compoundable, etc.

question: The Parliament passed the Marine Aids to Navigation Bill, 2021 to repeal and replace which of the following Acts? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: The Lighthouse Act, 1927 : An Act to consolidate and amend the law relating to the provision, maintenance and control of lighthouses by the Government. The Dangerous Machines (Regulation) Act, 1983, regulates the production, supply, distribution, and use of dangerous machines in India. The Personal Injuries (Emergency Provisions) Act, 1962, provides for relief regarding certain personal injuries sustained during the emergency period. The Dourine Act of 1910 was enacted to prevent the spread of dourine (a contagious disease that affects horses and asses) in India.

question: As of March 2023, how many High Courts are there in India? SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: 25. High Courts in India : The Indian High Courts Act of 1861, based on the recommendation of the Law Commission, led to the establishment of High Courts in the three Presidencies: Calcutta (1 July 1862), Madras (26 June 1862), and Bombay (14 August 1862). The 25th High Court was established in Andhra Pradesh in 2019.

question: Which of the following is NOT an amendment made to the Airport Economic Regulatory Authority (AERA) Amendment Act, 2021 ? SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (1st Shift)

question: For which of the following states was the Constitution (Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes) Orders (Second Amendment) Bill, 2022, introduced in the Parliament? SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: Uttar Pradesh. This Bill was introduced in Lok Sabha on March 28, 2022. The Bill seeks to amend the Constitution (Scheduled Tribes) (Uttar Pradesh) Order, 1967 (ST Order) and the Constitution (Scheduled Castes) Order, 1950 (SC Order) with respect to its application to Uttar Pradesh. The Bill amends the SC order to exclude Gond community as a Scheduled Caste in four districts of Uttar Pradesh: (i) Chandauli, (ii) Kushinagar, (iii) Sant Kabir Nagar, and (iv) Sant Ravidas Nagar.

question: Which Bill was passed by the Parliament, in July 2021, to help in the availability of working capital for the micro, small and medium enterprises sector? SSC CGL 13/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

The bill seeks to amend the Factoring Regulation Act, 2011 to widen the scope of entities which can engage in factoring business.

question: The Parliament passed the Essential Defence Services Bill, 2021 in August 2021: Which of the following is an objective behind passing it? SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (1st Shift)

solution.explanation: The Essential Defence Services Bill, 2021, introduced by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on July 22, 2021, defines essential defence services as those in establishments producing defence goods or in the armed forces and related areas. question: The Epidemic Diseases (Amendment) Ordinance, 2020 amended which of the following Acts? SSC CGL 18/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

solution.explanation: The Epidemic Diseases Act, 1897. The Epidemic Diseases (Amendment) Ordinance, 2020 was promulgated on April 22, 2020. The Ordinance amends the Act to include protections for healthcare personnel combatting epidemic diseases and expands the powers of the central government to prevent the spread of such diseases.

question: Which of the following States have enacted the Cattle Preservation Act, 2021 in July-August 2021 to regulate slaughter and transport of cattle and proposed an amendment in December 2021 to allow inter-district transportation of cattle for agricultural and animal husbandry except in districts sharing international border? SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (2nd Shift)

question: Who among the following cabinet ministers was appointed as the Governor of Karnataka in July 2021? SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (4th shift)

question: After being passed by both the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha, the Competition (Amendment) Bill, 2023 received the President’s assent on __________ to become the Competition (Amendment) Act, 2023. SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (4th shift)

question: In February 2023, which high court ordered that even foreigners can invoke Domestic Violence Act, 2005 in Indian courts and that the residence of women is immaterial? Matriculation Level 20/06/2024 (Shift - 1)

solution.explanation: Madras. The judgment clarified that foreigners can file complaints under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act (PWDVA) of 2005 in India. The residence of the woman is immaterial; she can seek protection in India regardless of her nationality or residence. This landmark decision aims to protect women from domestic violence.

question: As of 1 March 2022, which of the following bills were passed in December 2021 ? Matriculation Level 24/06/2024 (Shift - 4)

solution.explanation: The Election Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2021. The bill seeks to link electoral roll data and voter ID cards with the Aadhaar ecosystem. The National Anti-Doping Bill prohibits athletes, athlete support personnel and other persons from engaging in doping in sport. The Mediation Bill establishes the Mediation Council of India and also provides for community mediation. The Prohibition of Child Marriage (Amendment) Bill, 2021 for raising the age of marriage of women to 21 years to make it at par with the men.

question: Which of the following statements are true regarding Indian Antarctic Bill, 2022? 1: The Indian Antarctic Bill, 2022 was introduced in Lok Sabha on 1 Dec 2022: 2: The Bill seeks to give effect to the Antarctic Treaty, the Convention on the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources and the Protocol on Environmental Protection to the Antarctic Treaty: 3: It also seeks to protect the Antarctic environment and regulate activities in the region: 4: The provisions of the Bill will apply to any person, vessel or aircraft that is a part of an Indian expedition to Antarctica under a permit issued under the Bill. Higher Secondary 24/06/2024 (Shift - 2)

solution.explanation: 2, 3 and 4. The Indian Antarctic Bill, 2022 which aims at having India's own national measures for protecting the Antarctic environment. Introduced in the Lok Sabha on April 1, 2022, it received presidential assent on August 6, 2022. The bill applies to any person, vessel, or aircraft involved in India's Antarctic expeditions, as well as key areas of Antarctica, including the continent, islands, seas, and airspace south of 60°S latitude.

The Bill adds and exempts certain types of land from the purview of the Act. Further, it expands the list of activities permitted to be carried out on forest land.
